title: Benjamin Tucker
summary: Benjamin Ricketson Tucker (/ˈtʌkər/; April 17, 1854 – June 22, 1939) was an American anarchist and libertarian socialist.[1] A 19th-century proponent of individualist anarchism which (according to Daniel McCarthy in The American Conservative) he called "unterrified Jeffersonianism",[2] Tucker was the editor and publisher of the American individualist anarchist periodical Liberty (1881–1908) as well as a member of the socialist First International.[1]
